title: Roger Williams National Memorial: Park Home
body: Liberty of Conscience  Roger Williams National Memorial commemorates the life of the founder of Rhode Island and a champion of the ideal of religious freedom. Williams, banished from Massachusetts for his beliefs, founded Providence in 1636. This colony served as a refuge where all could come to worship as their conscience dictated without interference from the state. Read More             Become A Volunteer   Volunteers are Very Important People (VIP)! We need your skills and expertise in order to achieve our mission.            Kids Online Park Tour   Hey Kids! There's lots for you to do at Roger Williams National Memorial. Take a tour with Li'l Chap and learn how to become a Junior Ranger        Online Lesson Plans   Roger Williams National Memorial is excited to present online lesson plans. Download them here for free.
